intro: Parabarium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered parabarium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Parabarium micranthum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
